de.javasoft.swing.filter
Class ComparableColumnFilter<M>

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.beans.AbstractBean
      de.javasoft.swing.filter.ColumnFilter<M>
          de.javasoft.swing.filter.ComparableColumnFilter<M>

public class ComparableColumnFilter<M>
extends ColumnFilter<M>

ColumnFilter for Comparable types. Can handle single value and range comparisons. The filter component contains one or two JYFormattedFields, the first with a drop-down button to choose the match rule.

The default Formatter/Factory handles Number types with the default NumberFormat. Client code can configure this filter with a custom Formatter/Factory as appropriate for concrete Comparable type in the column. It's client code responsibility to guarantee matching types in formatters and column data.

Method Detail

setFormatter

public void setFormatter(javax.swing.JFormattedTextField.AbstractFormatter formatter)
Sets the formatter to use for parsing the text input. The formatter is wrapped into a DefaultFormatterFactory. As an implementation side-effect the current match value is cleared.

Parameters:
formatter - the formatter to use for parsing the text input, must not be null.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if formatter is null

Throws:

matchRuleChanged

protected void matchRuleChanged(java.lang.Object rule)
Callback method from listeners which detected a change in an input component which represents the matchRule as returned by the ui.

This implementation first calls updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChange and then sets the RowFilterModel's matchRule after unwrapping the given value into model coordinates.

Overridden to additonally update the match value if needed.

Overrides:
matchRuleChanged in class ColumnFilter<M>
Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null
See Also:
ColumnFilter.updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged(Object), ColumnFilter.unwrapMatchRule(Object)

updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged

protected void updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged(java.lang.Object rule)
Updates state of filter components as appropriate after a change of match rule. The input is the match rule as returned by the ui.

This implementation sets the ToolTip to the localized match rule name and updates the toField's visibility as needed.

Overrides:
updateComponentsAfterMatchRuleChanged in class ColumnFilter<M>
Parameters:
rule - the match rule as returned by the ui, must not be null

matchValueChanged

protected void matchValueChanged()
Description copied from class: ColumnFilter
Callback method from listeners which detected a change in an input component which represent the matchValue. This must be implemented to update the rowFilterModel's matchValue from the current value/s of the input components.

Specified by:
matchValueChanged in class ColumnFilter<M>

createRowFilterModel

protected IRowFilterModel<? extends M> createRowFilterModel(int columnIndex)
Description copied from class: ColumnFilter
Creates the RowFilterModel used in this ColumnFilter. This implementation creates a SimpleFilterModel. Subclasses should override as needed.

Overrides:
createRowFilterModel in class ColumnFilter<M>
Returns:
the default RowFilterModel used in this ColumnFilter.

createFilteringComponent

protected javax.swing.JComponent createFilteringComponent()
Creates and returns the filtering component (aka: the container to add into the filter row). This method is called once when the ColumnFilter's LifeCycle is in state INSTANTIATED. Subclasses must guarantee to have created and installed all internally used Components and Listeners.

Implemented to create a container filled with a JComboBox for choosing comparison type and a filterField to input/choose a comparison value.

Specified by:
createFilteringComponent in class ColumnFilter<M>
Returns:
the filtering component, must not be null.
